key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA channel is notable for having a higher price point on fares compared to the airline's website, occurring in 43.51% of observations.
MSE channel exhibits significant gaps with 57% offers not matching Turkish Airlines' direct channel, impacting visibility and competitiveness.
The GDS channel maintained a persistent trend of elevated pricing with 47.95% of prices higher than Turkish Airlines' website.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Most discrepancies in pricing are due to OTA-listed fares being higher, with an 87% presence across the dataset.
The percentage of itineraries where the OTA did not have the airline offer remains consistently around 55% for short hauls.
Long haul routes display a slightly higher frequency of OTA higher prices compared to short haul.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: OTA fares were higher in 43.51% of last week's observations, showing a slight decrease from the previous week.
Instances of OTA unavailability remain steady at approximately 56% this week, reflecting a minor increase from previous periods.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes consistently show more fares listed as higher on OTAs compared to the airline website.
Long haul flights have a progressive trend where OTA fares are notably higher, with a decrease in availability compared to the previous month.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Prices higher on OTAs make up 44.29% of Turkish-origin routes, reflecting a minor week-on-week decrease.
Although showing less overall disparity, international (Non-TR) itineraries are aligned with domestic trends, maintaining stability in price variances.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: For bookings closer to the travel date, OTA fares are commonly higher, with 43.94% marked as such last week.
Far-out bookings see a consistent trend of OTA fares being higher, although a minor decrease in these occurrences was observed compared to last month.

mse_highlights.line_content: The MSE channel frequently lacks parity with the airline's own offers, exhibiting over 57% average price listings not found in the metasearch engines.
Pricing between MSE and the airline's direct channel remains stable, with only 12.73% of the itineraries priced lower on the MSE.
MSE priced lower itineraries declined over the past month by 1.85%, indicating a slight contraction in discount offerings.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Offers not found on MSE increased by 8.76% from the previous month, suggesting growing gaps in metasearch visibility.
The percentage of itineraries with the same prices has decreased by 6.82% month-over-month, indicating a slight instability in maintaining consistent pricing across channels.
Instances where MSE prices were higher than the airline's were practically nonexistent, recorded at 0.02%.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short haul routes show a predominantly non-presence on MSE, with over 58% offers not apparent, while nearly 30% showed same pricing.
MSE demonstrates price competitiveness on long-haul routes, with 26.76% priced lower than the direct channel, showcasing strategic potential.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Over half of Turkish-origin flights are not listed, with a 10% increase from last month, highlighting missed opportunities for exposure.
There is a significant difference with 39.27% of Non-Turkish origin itineraries discovered cheaper on MSE, enhancing value perception.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE channel offers are less frequent close to departure, with approximately 56% not found, indicating inefficiencies at capturing late-bookers.
Far-out bookings show a higher percentage of similar pricing structures, equating to over 24%, reflecting initial strategical pricing agreements.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS channel shows higher prices compared to the airline website for 47.95% of samples, reflecting a persistent trend of elevated pricing on GDS in recent weeks.
Instances of the GDS channel exactly matching the airline's website pricing are negligible, indicating strategic pricing differentiation on the channel.
Over 50% of recorded offers are not found on the GDS channel, highlighting website-exclusive deals that are unavailable through GDS.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: A significant portion of GDS rates (47.95%) are higher than those found on the airline's website, seeing a slight decrease from the previous weeks.
Offers missing from the GDS remain consistently high, showing a 4.14% weekly increase.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: GDS prices are notably higher for Short Haul, with a persistent weekly increase.
Long Haul prices show slight but consistent elevation on GDS over the airline site.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Turkey-origin flights, GDS shows higher pricing 49.17% of the time, although the trend is diminishing slightly week-over-week.
For Non-TR origins, GDS higher prices are documented 43.88% of the time, showing minimal week-over-week decline.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-In bookings on GDS frequently exhibit higher pricing, with around 48.22% priced above the web offer.
Far-Out booking window fares are also GDS higher at a rate of 47.43%, showing little change from the previous period.
